sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Israel's Prime Minister has ordered the military to prepare a civilian evacuation plan for Rafah as it plans to invade the city which Israel claims is Hamas' last stronghold.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The announcement comes after more than 20 people were killed in strikes on central Gaza and Rafah.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, criticism of the Israeli offensive in Gaza is also growing, with President Biden saying that the military campaign is over the top. The UN World Food Programme's director in Palestine said on Friday that famine could hit Gaza as early as May. The lack of food has put half the population at risk of famine, with the situation worse in the north, which is almost inaccessible to aid convoys. The Israeli army has also released footage of what it says are airstrikes against Hamas targets that killed 15 militants in Khan Yunis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: have been able to return home. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said that most of the returning prisoners of war defended Mariupol, adding that over 3,100 Ukrainians have been released from Russian captivity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Joy was also among Russian soldiers, transported to Moscow for treatment and rehabilitation in medical institutions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The exchange took place as Russia continued to pummel Ukraine with long-range strikes.

sentences.sentence: Russian meal bloggers also claimed advances in northern Avdiivka up to Chistyakova street and the capture of a nearby section of a railway line, although the Institute for the Study of War has not observed visual evidence of these claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Donald Trump has won Nevada's Republican caucuses, his third state victory in a row.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Trump was the only major candidate to compete in Nevada. In his victory speech, Trump said he was eager to win in his next stop, South Carolina, the home state of his main rival Nikki Haley. Trump remains popular in the deeply conservative state, but Haley, who won two elections as South Carolina's governor, is hoping her local roots will give her a competitive edge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: The candidates are former centre-right Prime Minister Alexander Stubb and ex-Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto of the Greens.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Both call for Finland, which recently joined NATO, to take a tough stance against Russia.

The European Union will support Mauritania with 210 million euros to combat human trafficking by preventing migrant boats from making the dangerous Atlantic crossing between West Africa and Europe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The European Commission President and the Prime Minister of Spain went to the Mauritanian capital, Nouakchott, to make the announcement.

sentences.sentence: We are witnessing the fall of democratic governments, rise of terrorist attacks, a spike in refugees and internally displaced people, and the worsening of an already acute food security crisis. We need to work together and with a comprehensive strategy if we want to address these challenges successfully.

sentences.sentence: Checking in to go sightseeing in North Korea. This group of Russian tourists have become the likely first visitors to enter the country since the COVID-19 pandemic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: They will then go on to the Masik Pass on the east coast, where the country's most modern ski resort is located.
